Description: Central part of a grey limestone stelophorous figure of Amenemhat; on the stela is a remains of a double scene of Amenhotep III offering to Amun-Ra above fifteen(surviving rows of Hieroglyphic text; additional columns of Hieroglyphic text on the sides and back-pillar; upper body and lower legs of the figure lost.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1925 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 7. (pl.42)
Condition: incomplete - upper body and lower legs lost
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Amenhotep III
